original: MALMFORS, Sam Karl, Kraftverks direktör, Falun, f Norberg, Västml l, 20/11 88 av järn-handl J Pettersson o Matilda Andersson, gm Xenia Ohlsson. Studex N Latin 08, civilingex KTH (eltekn) 12. Resoffex 12, uljt 13, ljt 18, avsk 20. Ass KTH o Graham Brothers Sthlm 13—16, ch ry fman Grah Broth, Petrograd, 17, distr.ing Älvkarleby kraftvk 18—20, ing Torpshammars AB 20—22, 1. byråing Vat.f.styr 22— 24, förest dess Norrl.avd 24—29, kraftvksdir o ch Norrl kraftvkn 29—32, dir St Kopparb bergsl kraftvk sed. 32. Ch stat ind.kommiss :s bränsle- o kraftavd 40. Styr.led Sv el.ing.frn, Sv elvksfrn, Sv vat.kr.frn, Dalälvens regl.-föret, Västerdalälvens kraftAB. Resor: Ryssl 17, Frankr, Ital, Schweiz 29, Tyskl 36. Av trycket: Utredn betr planmäss elektrifier av Norrb:s landsbygd (24), fi skrifter rör el kraftdistribution. RVO; Frimurare, S :t ör-jens Gille, Kraftvksklubben. Hobbies: Musik, litteratur.
translated: MALMFORS, Sam Karl, Power Plant Director, Falun, born in Norberg, Västmanland county, on November 20, 1888, to iron merchant J Pettersson and Matilda Andersson, married to Xenia Ohlsson. Completed secondary school at Latin School in 1908, graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) with a degree in electrical engineering in 1912. Commissioned officer in 1912, promoted to second lieutenant in 1913, and lieutenant in 1918. Discharged in 1920. Assistant at KTH and Graham Brothers in Stockholm from 1913 to 1916, chief engineer at Grah Brothers in Petrograd in 1917, district engineer at Älvkarleby power plant from 1918 to 1920, engineer at Torpshammars AB from 1920 to 1922, first engineer at the Water Works Authority from 1922 to 1924, head of the Northern department from 1924 to 1929, power plant director and chief of Northern Power Plants from 1929 to 1932, director of Stora Kopparbergs Bergslagens power plant since 1932. Chairman of the state industrial commissioners fuel and power department in 1940. Board member of the Swedish Association of Electrical Engineers, Swedish Power Plants Association, Swedish Water Authorities, Dalälven Regulation Company, and Västerdalälvens Power AB. Travelled to Russia in 1917, France, Italy, and Switzerland in 1929, and Germany in 1936. Published investigations on systematic electrification of rural areas in Norrbotten (1924) and writings on electric power distribution. Received the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO) and is a member of Freemasons, St. Erik's Guild, and the Power Plant Club. Hobbies include music and literature.

structured.name: Sam Karl Malmfors
structured.description: Sam Karl Malmfors was a Swedish Power Plant Director, born on November 20, 1888, in Norberg, Västmanland County. He was married to Xenia Ohlsson. Malmfors completed his secondary education at Latin School in 1908 and graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) with a degree in Electrical Engineering in 1912. He held various positions including Assistant at KTH and Graham Brothers in Stockholm, Chief Engineer at Grah Brothers in Petrograd, and District Engineer at Älvkarleby Power Plant. Malmfors also worked as an engineer at Torpshammars AB and the Water Works Authority before becoming the Power Plant Director and Chief of Northern Power Plants in 1929. Since 1932, he served as the Director of Stora Kopparbergs Bergslagens Power Plant. Malmfors was actively involved in several organizations such as the Swedish Association of Electrical Engineers, Swedish Power Plants Association, Swedish Water Authorities, Dalälven Regulation Company, Västerdalälvens Power AB, Freemasons, St. Erik's Guild, and the Power Plant Club. He received the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO) for his contributions in the field. Malmfors had a strong interest in music and literature.
